page.title: 18The Ambulance Crew.
page.content: The ambulance crew consists of 17 people, 16 road staff and one officer.There are three female drivers.All the crew live locally in South Shropshire.They train for 6 weeks at Pelsall near Walsall Wood in the West Midlands.There are two shifts one in the morning and one at night.The busiest duty is normally on Saturday and Sunday. The crew attend the Ludlow races in case a jockey is injured.Should a jockey be injured the ambulance wont leave until another comes to take its place. The crew often visit schools giving demonstrations and showing the children the ambulance. The laundry van arrives every week to collect the blankets and uniforms. Crews attend refresher courses every 5 years.
